info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 1:43PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Hamilton and western Fulton Counties through 215 PM EDT... At 143 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Caroga Lake, or 11 miles northwest of Gloversville, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Stratford, Caroga Lake, Caroga Lake Public Campground, Arietta, Rockwood, Lotville, Doxtater Corner, Shaker Place, Scotchbrush, Phipps Corners, North Bush, Wheelerville, Canada Lake, Glasgow Mills, Newkirk, Averys Place, Bliss Corner, Dempster Corners, Stewart Landing and Peters Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern New York.
